posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello David, and welcome back!

I've just had a quick look at the Nordock link and it says that smith-dwarf also gets Expertise, so you have another feat to play with. It also looks like you're taking Power Attack twice, so that's another one - hooray! Now that's good for another reason as well, as you'll only need 5 levels of Fighter pre-epic (with WM7 in there to replace it), so you can use the level 6 bonus feat for EWS, thereby freeing up a general feat. I'd look at only taking those 6 levels of Fighter and taking 8 levels of WM, as Nordock gives the WM +2 strength for every 8 levels taken. And it will also give you the space to include Devastating Critical.

As I say, that's just on a quick look, but might it be a reasonable direction?

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
A couple more quickies.

That remaining spare feat pre-epic could be used for Knockdown.

I can't see anything to suggest you need a starting Dex of 15, so I'd drop that to 12 (particularly with the smith getting a -5 to Dex), assuming you'll be wearing full plate of course. And I'm not sure why you want your Wis at 11 either, but you probably have a good reason. That should give you some more points to play with at creation (with or without any changes to Wis).

Equally, and given that you'll be getting +4 to Con from DwD (+2 at 10 and another +2 at 20), even with a final Con of 22 (for EDR III) you'll have a ridiculously high hp pool, so you wouldn't need to use so many stat bumps for it - 2 should be enough. So even more for Strength becomes available.

I notice, though, that you don't currently take EDR II, just I and III, so you'll need to change that. And you might also think about taking Armor Skin as well.

Admittedly, that looks bad for taking all the Great Strengths you want, but with the changes I'm suggesting you'll end up with a higher Str anyway (2 from stat bumps, 2 from WM 8, and at least 1 from dropping Dex down, and maybe another if you do the same with Wis).

Please tell me if I'm barking up the wrong tree here!

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hmm...

I've also been thinking about available skill points, and they're fairly horrible at the moment - only 129. So I wondered about taking Int 14, making it a more respectable 172. If I've got my sums right, your starting (finishing) stats could then read:

Str 16 (30) [comprising 16 + 9 stat bumps + 2 WM level 8 + 3 Great Strengths]
Dex 10 [losing 1 AC]
Con 16 (21) [comprising 16 + 1 stat bump + 4 DwD level 20. That's enough for EDR III and still gives 692 hps]
Wis 12 [to be tidy and boost will save by 1. And with a +3 to Wis at creation, 11 is your minimum real starting point]
Int 14 [for the extra 43 skill points]
Cha 6

That would enable you to take all your current pre-epic feats (though I'd still swap Imp Power Attack for Knockdown), and 3 Great Strengths, EWF, Ow Crit, Dev Crit and Epic Prowess as general epic feats, with EWS as your epic Fighter bonus feat, and EDR I, II and III as well as Armor Skin (and the extra AC is very useful, particularly if dropping Dex down to 10) as DwD bonus feats.

As far as the skills go, you can max Discipline (43 pts), cross class 20 in Tumble (costing 40 pts), and take your 4 in Intimidate (costing 8). That still leaves you with 81 points to play with, which is almost 2 more maxed skills - such as Spellcraft (cross classed again), Listen, and Concentration.

How does that sound?

Cheers
